Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the Clean Power Plan by stating that it eliminates coal-fired power plants, when in reality it only requires phase-outs of many existing coal-fueled plants.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Clean Power Plan eliminates coal-fired power plants without providing enough evidence or support for this assumption.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to back up the assertion that the Clean Power Plan eliminates coal-fired power plants.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, as experts have stated that the plan does not outlaw coal as fuel or require coal-fired plants to close, but rather targets outdated and inefficient coal plants.
